data.text:
Salamanca Climate Summary

Located at an elevation of None meters (0 feet) above sea level, Salamanca has a Mid-latitude steppe climate (Classification: BSk). The district’s yearly temperature is 17.9ºC (64.22ºF) and it is -4.13% lower than Mexico’s averages. Salamanca typically receives about 78.35 millimeters (3.08 inches) of precipitation and has 115.17 rainy days (31.55% of the time) annually.
